title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: South African ambassador 'no longer welcome' in US, Rubio says
items.description: The US Secretary of State called the ambassador a "race-baiting politician who hates America".

items.title: After Columbia arrests, international college students fall silent

items.title: Extreme weather expected Saturday gets rarely used ‘high risk’ designation
items.description: A dynamic storm system threatening to spawn powerful tornadoes and hail as big as baseballs has earned a relatively rare designation from forecasters.

items.title: Islamic State leader in Iraq and Syria killed, US says
items.description: Abdallah Makki Muslih al-Rifa was head of IS's most senior decision-making body, the US Central Command said.

items.title: Search continues in Dominican Republic for missing student Sudiksha Konanki
items.description: The search for the missing University of Pittsburgh student, who was on spring break in Punta Cana, is entering its second week.

items.title: More than 50 universities face federal investigations as part of Trump’s anti-DEI campaign
Ovens and bone fragments - BBC visits Mexican cartel 'extermination' site
items.description: The BBC's Will Grant visits the site believed to have been used by drug cartels to dispose of victims' remains.

items.title: Appeals court rules Trump can implement anti-DEI executive orders for now
items.description: The decision from the three-judge panel allows the orders to be enforced as a lawsuit challenging them plays out.

items.title: Arlington National Cemetery stops highlighting some historical figures on its website
items.description: Articles, photos and videos that are seen as promoting DEI will be removed under the new approach.

items.title: 'Their untold stories need to be told': Teens capture India's labourers in pictures
items.description: Teen photographers showcased the backbreaking work done by India's 400 million labourers.

items.title: Leader of ISIS in Iraq and Syria killed, Pentagon says
items.description: On his Truth Social platform Friday night, President Trump wrote that "the fugitive leader of ISIS in Iraq was killed."

items.title: Turmoil rocks Columbia University as Trump administration demands changes — or else

items.title: Tesla, led by Elon Musk, warns of export retaliation due to new Trump tariffs
items.description: Tesla has joined the ranks of U.S. companies concerned that Trump's aggressive tariff policies may negatively affect global sales.
